ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would definitely recommend this class to a student interest in French literature, especially if you are interested in close reading/analysis. Professor Connolly is amazing, definitely take advantage of office hours when you're writing papers!

I would absolutely recommend this class. It was such a small seminar, which allowed us to really know each other and have very comfortable and open conversations. There was a pretty big variety of comfort levels with speaking French, and Professor Connolly did an amazing job of making sure the less fluent students weren't lost while never dumbing down conversations. I never felt judged for being less articulate in French than many students in the room were.

Great introduction to Modern French Poetry. A lot of readings, but (almost) all of them fascinating and enriching.Class discussion will depend a lot on the instructor and the fellow students (and their level of competency with respect to discussing poetry in French). Prof. Connolly was great; I can only recommend taking a class with him.
I'd recommend it. It's a class for everyone, from fluent speakers to people who are much less confident in their skills. Professor Connolly is extremely helpful both inside and outside of class.

This is a really fun course! Interesting, beautiful material, well-organized and well-taught, and your French will improve by leaps and bounds (class discussion is fast-paced and the vocabulary in the readings can be challenging). If you're considering this as a fifth course, be aware that it can be a lot of work--we read not just the literature itself, but a number of lengthy and difficult theoretical texts. That said, the writing assignments are approachable and a lot of fun, and Prof. Connolly gives lots of detailed, wonderfully helpful feedback. Would recommend--if the material interests you, take it!
